item.title: Mark Zuckerberg Is The Most Followed User On Google+
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg Is The Most Followed User On Google+ http://tcrn.ch/lYuD0w by @alexia
item.content:encoded: Mark Zuckerberg Is The Most Followed User On Google+ http://tcrn.ch/lYuD0w by @alexia In what must be somewhat embarrassing for Larry Page and Sergey Brin, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg is the most followed user on Google+, according to the Google+ Statistics counter. The Facebook CEO has 21,213 followers, compared to the Google CEO at 14,798, Google social czar Vic Gundotra at 13,783, Google co-founder Sergey Brin at 11,629, blogger Robert Scoble at 11,389, Google spam avenger Matt Cutts at 9,153, TWIT founder Leo Laporte at 7,566, Google's Bradley Horowitz at 7,187, TechCrunch's MG Siegler at 6,579 and blogger Gina Trapani at 5,649. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

item.title: WordPress › WordPress 3.2 now available
item.description: Wordpress 3.2 http://t.co/KbW2OcL
item.content:encoded: Wordpress 3.2 http://t.co/KbW2OcL Here in the U.S. we are observing Independence Day, and I can’t think of a more fitting way to mark a day that celebrates freedom than by releasing more free software to help democratize publishing around the globe. I’m excited to announce that WordPress 3.2 is now available to the world, both as an update in your dashboard and a download on WordPress.org. Version 3.2 is our fifteenth major release of WordPress and comes just four months after 3.1 (which coincidentally just passed the 15 million download mark this morning), reflecting the growing speed of development in the WordPress community and our dedication to getting improvements in your hands as soon as possible. We’re dedicating this release to noted composer and pianist George Gershwin. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: wordpress.org

item.title: How This Year’s Tech IPOs Are Doing, And Who’s Next
item.description: How This Year's Tech IPOs Are Doing, And Who's Next http://tcrn.ch/if0Qql by @leenarao
item.content:encoded: How This Year's Tech IPOs Are Doing, And Who's Next http://tcrn.ch/if0Qql by @leenarao Bubble or not, 2011 may go down as the year of the tech IPO. Not since the last bubble have we seen so many technology companies clamoring to go public. And halfway through the year, we still have many more companies who will be listing on either the NASDAQ or the NYSE in the next six months. Here's a roundup of the tech companies that have gone public, where they are trading now, and who we can expect to see ringing the bell next. Professional social network LinkedIn probably had the biggest IPO in terms of hype this year because it was one of the first big social media companies to go public. After pricing its IPO at $45 per share on the New York Stock Exchange, LinkedIn began trading at $83.00 per share on May 19, giving the company a $7.8 billion market cap. In the first day of trading, shares popped up to as high as $122.70, soaring past a $10 billion valuation. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

item.title: WordPress 3.1 Downloaded Over 15 Million Times In Under 5 Months
item.description: WordPress 3.1 Downloaded 15 Million Times In Under 5 Months http://tcrn.ch/jSTqd2 by @robinwauters
item.content:encoded: WordPress 3.1 Downloaded 15 Million Times In Under 5 Months http://tcrn.ch/jSTqd2 by @robinwauters The latest stable version of WordPress, 3.1, was first released on 23 February 2011. Now, less than 5 months later, the blogging software has been downloaded over 15 million times according to a tweet posted mere minutes ago. Just yesterday, WordPress parent company Automattic published a blog post, announcing that the next version, WordPress 3.2, will be released 'very soon'. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

item.title: Gadget Week On Fly Or Die (TCTV)
item.description: Gadget Week On Fly Or Die (TCTV) http://tcrn.ch/jcvzW0 by @johnbiggs
item.content:encoded: Gadget Week On Fly Or Die (TCTV) http://tcrn.ch/jcvzW0 by @johnbiggs In this episode of Fly Or Die we go through a few popular gadgets including the MacBook-alike HP Probook 5330m, the EFun Nextbook, and the Nokia N9. We found most of the devices to be acceptable but we were in agreement about the crablet EFun Nextbook which is about the worst piece of garbage imaginable (based on our extensive test that involved us looking at the thing as it crashed constantly.) Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

item.description: French See Strauss-Kahn Case as American Folly: A dormant anti-Americanism has been reawakened here, fueled by ... http://nyti.ms/jJjE9H
item.content:encoded: French See Strauss-Kahn Case as American Folly: A dormant anti-Americanism has been reawakened here, fueled by ... http://nyti.ms/jJjE9H Dormant anti-Americanism has been reawakened in France, fueled by a sense that the culture of the United States has undermined fair play. item.title: Was the Millennium Falcon found at the bottom of the Baltic Sea?
item.description: Was the Millennium Falcon found at the bottom of the Baltic Sea? http://io9.com/5817761/
item.content:encoded: Was the Millennium Falcon found at the bottom of the Baltic Sea? http://io9.com/5817761/ On June 19, maritime treasure hunters looking for priceless submerged hooch in shipwrecks discovered a solid, 60-foot-diameter circle 87 meters under the Baltic Sea. Are we looking at the remains of an alien vessel or Cthulhu's personal pan pizza? Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: io9.com
